item.title: Grays inn road towards theobald road in the general area where I showed, can't remember exact, 15th August
item.description:
The branches are overhanging into the cycle lane going towards theobalds road and it just got hit by a few branches whilst cycling, please remove asap

item.title: Too much chewing gum on the High Street, 15th August
item.description:
Why choose boring dirty looking paving slabs when you can purchase excellent Spanish dynamic patterns. And the dirty grey slabs look even worse when covered with black blobs of spat out chewing gum!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Franklin Road, Penge, London

item.title: Problem not fixed, 15th August
item.description:
Hi, with reference to report 8024222, why have you closed this case without any action. This area is maintained by Peabody. This rubbish might not be Peabodys but if Peabody ground keepers don't attend who will clear all this rubbish away. There is loads of rubbish each side of the bridge both by the new drain covers. This is what I wrote in the first report. Following your contractors replacing the damaged drain covers, they have left this area in appalling condition. They have left all the repair rubbish all over this area. Peabody should have them return to clear up this mess. It might be woodlands but they would not been allowed to leave all this rubbish if it was in a street. I can't belive that Peabody had not checked on there work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastern Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet
